org.archive.wayback.accesscontrol.robotstxt

Class RobotRulesTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.archive.wayback.accesscontrol.robotstxt.RobotRulesTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class RobotRulesTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase
    Tests for RobotRules

    References:

    • https://developers.google.com/webmasters/control-crawl-index/docs/robots_txt - referred as "Google/Yahoo/Bing/Ask (GYBA) convention".
    • http://www.robotstxt.org/orig.html
    • http://www.robotstxt.org/norobots-rfc.txt - referred as "RFC".

    Note: GYBA convention document and RFC differs in terminology. What GYBA calls "group" is called "record" in RFC.

    Author:
    brad

      • testNonBlocksPathForUA

        public void testNonBlocksPathForUA()
                            throws Exception
        multiple records for different User-agent's.

        while RFC states "the format logically consists of a non-empty set or records, separated by blank lines", Google's documentation has no mention to blank lines as group separator - instead, it recognizes a sequence of User-agent: as the start of "group". So this sample is syntax error per RFC, but okay according to Google/Yahoo/Bing/Ask convention.

        Throws:
        Exception

      • testMultiUAWithOtherLinesLine

        public void testMultiUAWithOtherLinesLine()
                                   throws Exception
        there's sitemap (non-allow/disallow) directive after User-agent. next user-agent should start a new group. ia_archiver ALLOWED as disallow rule only applies to B.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testMultiUAWithOtherLinesLine2

        public void testMultiUAWithOtherLinesLine2()
                                    throws Exception
        similarly to previous test case, Crawl-delay: line shall end the group.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testBlankLineInGroup

        public void testBlankLineInGroup()
                          throws Exception
        this is a syntax error per RFC, but ok with Google/Yahoo/Bing/Ask convention. blank lines are permitted within a group to improve readability. they are simply ignored, don't end group.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testMultiUA

        public void testMultiUA()
                 throws Exception
        multiple User-agent: for a record. ia_archiver BLOCKED as disallow rule applies to both all and B
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testSubpath

        public void testSubpath()
                 throws Exception
        path matching basics. substring-based, / is no special, and case-sensitive.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testPercentEncodedPath

        public void testPercentEncodedPath()
                            throws Exception
        character may be %-escaped, but %2f (/) is special. (TODO: additional tests: robots.txt is assumed to be UTF-8 encoded. non-7bit-ascii characters are allowed, and also can be %-escaped.)
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testMostSpecificPathPrevails

        public void testMostSpecificPathPrevails()
                                  throws Exception

        By GYBA convention, if multiple disallow and allow directives matches the URL, the most specific rule based on the length of the path will win over less specific (shorter) ones.

        RFC says differently: "a robot must attempt to match the paths in Allow and Disallow lines against the URL, in the order they occur in the record. The first match found is used."

        we follow GYBA convention here.

        Throws:
        Exception

      • testWildcardMatch

        public void testWildcardMatch()
                       throws Exception
        wildcard in path, matches any chars including /. /* is the same as /.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testEndOfPath

        public void testEndOfPath()
                   throws Exception
        Google/Bing/Yahoo/Ask extension: $ matches the end of path.
        Throws:
        Exception
